title: Court of Appeal for Ontario
data: Superior Court of Justice ( 1991 to 2013 ) Pardu Macdonald ( 1976 to 1991 )
Superior Court of Justice ( 2002 to 2005 ) Heenan Blaikie
section_text: A courtroom at Osgoode Hall . Over the dais are the Royal Arms of the United Kingdom , which until 1931 were the Royal Arms for general purposes throughout the British Empire . The Statute of Westminster 1931 effectively elevated the Royal Arms of Canada to the position of the Queen 's Royal Arms for general purposes across Canada , which is why the Royal Arms of Canada are now used by the court to represent the Canadian Crown . intro: The Court of Appeal for Ontario (frequently referred to as the Ontario Court of Appeal or ONCA) is the appellate court for the province of Ontario, Canada. The seat of the court is Osgoode Hall in downtown Toronto, also the seat of the Law Society of Ontario and the Divisional Court of the Ontario Superior Court of Justice.
